channel.title: 🪴 My Garden on
channel.description: Recent content in 🪴 My Garden on

item.title: 2022 Master Plan
item.description: My 2022 capacity will be 1009 hours, I’ve written an article about it here. Base pillars of 2022: Note: A goal must be defiend clearly and must be in my control, it must also have a clear end destination to be marked as completed

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi, my name is Tepes Alexandru, I’m 19 and living in Romania. I’m a software engineer at Qubiz, and currently in my second year of Computer Science in Oradea.

item.title: Atomic Habits | Notes
item.description: Book Notes: A 1% improvement every day will make you 37 times better in a year. Building systems is a lot better than just setting goals.

item.title: Iteration 1 - 2022
item.description: Iteration #1 Notes After some research, I’ve found that there is another possible Scrum certification I go for: Professional Scrum Developer (PSD).

item.title: NextJS - Episode 1
item.description: NextJS - Episode 1: Introduction Estimated script reading time ~5 minutes. Estimated video time ~10 minutes. To view the sliders, click here.

item.title: NextJS - Episode 2
item.description: NextJS - Episode 2: Routing Estimated script reading time ~0 minutes. Estimated video time ~0 minutes. Introduction Hi everyone and welcome to the second episode in this series.

item.title: NextJS Learning Journey
item.description: I’ve been curious for quite a while to learn more about NextJS, so I’m doing that! I’m researching the topic and creating scripts for videos talking about NextJS while building a project.

item.title: NextJS Research
item.description: Multiple pages create a new page using the integrated file system routing use the Link component to enable client side navigation between pages learn about built-in support for code splitting and prefetching A page in NextJS is a react component exported from the pages directory.

item.title: PSM I - Study Notes
item.description: Welcome to my study notes, explore the following question packs to learn for the PSM I certification. Question Packs - 57 Questions 📚 Scrum Artifacts | 9 Questions

item.title: Q1 Plan - 2022
item.description: Timeframe: 1st of January - 31 of March. 3 months/12 Weeks/90 days. Theoretical Capacity: 250 Hours. Main directions for this quarter:

item.title: Q1 Progress - 2022
item.description: Business Articles (5/25) Scrum Values (5 article series) Youtube NextJS Episode 1 Research, Script & Sliders, Voice Over

item.title: Q2 Plan - 2022
item.description: **Timefram Timeframe: 1st of April - 30 of June. Theoretical Capacity: 250 Hours.

item.title: Q3 Plan - 2022
item.description: **Timefram Timeframe: 1st of July - 30 of September. Theoretical Capacity: 250 Hours.

item.title: Q4 Plan - 2022
item.description: **Timefram Timeframe: 1st of October - 31 of December. Theoretical Capacity: 250 Hours.

item.title: Retrospective Weeks 1-2
item.description: Keep My private lessons are doing fine. More Jump workouts have been going great, and I feel like I can push the limit every week by a bit.

item.title: Scrum Artifacts | Questions Pack
item.description: Question 1 What is the order of items in the Product Backlog? Answer: Less valuable and most unclear items at the bottom.

item.title: Scrum Events | Questions Pack
item.description: Question 1 What are the Scrum Events? The Sprint Retrospective The Daily Scrum The Sprint Planning The Sprint Review Question 2 Who is allowed to participate in the Daily Scrum?

item.title: Scrum Learning Journey
item.description: I am publishing a series of articles on Medium about my Scrum learning journey. The final purpose of the journey is to get the Professional Scrum Master 1 certification.

item.title: Scrum Roles | Questions Pack
item.description: Question 1 What are the characteristics of a Development Team? Accountability belongs to the Development Team as a whole. Scrum recognizes no sub-teams in the Development Team.

item.title: Scrum Theory | Questions Pack
item.description: Question 1 How frequently should scrum users inspect Scrum artifacts and progress toward a Sprint Goal? Answer: Frequently, but it should not get in the way of the work.

item.title: Scrum Values
item.description: Start of the Journey The best introduction to the Scrum Framework is by starting with its values. This is a small 5 part series going through each one: Focus, Openness, Courage, Commitment and Respect.

item.title: Week 1 - 2022
item.description: Health Take 7 showers (one per day) (4/7) ❌ Jump-Rope Workout (17m/ 15 min) Monday: 1m Tuesday: 2m Wednesday: 3m Thursday: 11m + 13m = 24m Business Publish 2 Articles about Scrum Values (3/2) Work on The Boring Team for 9 hours (1.

item.title: Week 2 - 2022
item.description: Health Take 7 showers (3/7) ❌ Jump Rope workout (32m/35 minutes) => 5 minutes per day ❌ Monday - 5m Wednesday - 10m Thursday - 4m Saturday- 5m Sunday - 7m Business Publish 1 Medium articles about Scrum Research NextJS (1/2 hours) ❌ Build NextJS Episode 1 script (2/2 hours) Create NextJS Episode 1 sliders (2/2 hours)🌟 NextJS Episode 1 Voice Over (1h) 🌟 Solidity research (1h) 🌟 Knowledge Read the Scrum Guide once (3.

item.title: Week 3 - 2022
item.description: Health Take 7 showers (4/7) Jump Rope workout (50 minutes) => 7 minutes per day Tuesday => 8m Wednesday => 9m Business - 8h NextJS Research (1h/2h) Episode 2 Script Writing (30m/1h) Episode 2 Sliders (1h) Episode 2 Voice Over (1h) Episode 3 Script Writing (1h) Episode 3 Sliders (1h) Episode 3 Voice Over (1h) Knowledge - 10h Study for the PSM I Certificate (7h) Note down the 87 practice questions and answers (1h/4h) Practice exam twice (2h) Free Research (1h) Listen from the Atomic Habits audiobook during lunch (1h/2h) Take notes from Atomic Habits (10m/1h) University - 3h Join Statistics Lecture (1.
